components.description:
A squirt gun (water pistol), as used to spray water for fun.

On major platforms, depicted as a green or orange toy gun with an orange tip and barrel pointed left. Google and Facebook’s designs include mounted reservoirs.

Originally depicted as a classic handgun, as a revolver or other pistol. In 2016, Apple switched its design from weapon to toy; other major vendors followed suit by 2018. Deprecated emoji sets or smaller platforms still display the emoji as a handgun. 

In July 2024, X / Twitter updated this emoji's design to once again show a real firearm. In August 2024 the firearm's design was changed, and also made available for iOS platforms.

Microsoft initially displayed the emoji as a toy ray gun before switching to a revolver, then squirt gun. Google once featured a blunderbuss.
components.title: Pistol

description:
A squirt gun (water pistol), as used to spray water for fun.

On major platforms, depicted as a green or orange toy gun with an orange tip and barrel pointed left. Google and Facebook’s designs include mounted reservoirs.

Originally depicted as a classic handgun, as a revolver or other pistol. In 2016, Apple switched its design from weapon to toy; other major vendors followed suit by 2018. Deprecated emoji sets or smaller platforms still display the emoji as a handgun. 

In July 2024, X / Twitter updated this emoji's design to once again show a real firearm. In August 2024 the firearm's design was changed, and also made available for iOS platforms.

Microsoft initially displayed the emoji as a toy ray gun before switching to a revolver, then squirt gun. Google once featured a blunderbuss.
title: Pistol

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Tool symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: AÂ gun emoji, more precisely aÂ pistol. AÂ weapon that has potential to cause great harm. Displayed facing right-to-left on all platforms. iOS  http://emojipedia.org/pistol/
emoji_net_data.name: pistol

bn:00113616a: (of an emotion or natural force) very strong or powerful; acting with or marked by great force or energy or emotional intensity.
Acting with or marked by or resulting from great force or energy or emotional intensity

bn:00100969a: Causing death; deadly, fatal, killing, lethal (now only of wounds, injuries etc.).
Causing death or having the ability to cause death.
Causing or capable of causing death

bn:13731683v: To shoot (at) a target with a pistol.

bn:00089122v: To shoot someone or something, usually with a firearm.

bn:00089349v: Hit with a missile from a weapon
To discharge a missile; said of a weapon.

bn:00035772n: An act of aggression (as one against a person who resists)

The World Health Organization defines violence as "the intentional use of physical force or power, threatened or actual, against oneself, another person, or against a group or community, which either results in or has a high likelihood of resulting in injury, death, psychological harm, maldevelopment, or deprivation," but acknowledges that the inclusion of "the use of power" in its definition expands on the conventional meaning of the word.
The use of physical force to cause injury, damage or death
A content descriptor developed by the Computer Entertainment Rating Organization (CERO).
Intentional use of physical force or power often resulting in injury or death
A content descriptor developed by the Pan European Gaming Information (PEGI) and the British Board of Film Classification (BBFC).
Violence is any act of aggression and/or abuse that causes or intends to cause injury to persons, animals, or property.

bn:00067576n: A pistol with a revolving cylinder (usually having six chambers for bullets)
Revolver with a cylinder that holds six bullets. A six-gun.
A handgun with a revolving chamber enabling several shots to be fired without reloading.
Handgun that has a cylinder containing multiple chambers and at least one barrel
A revolver is a repeating firearm that has a revolving cylinder containing multiple chambers and at least one barrel for firing.
A revolver with a cylinder that holds six bullets.

bn:00005704n: An instrument of attack or defense in combat, as a gun, missile, or sword.
Any instrument or instrumentality used in fighting or hunting
An instrument of attack or defense in combat or hunting, e.g. most guns, missiles, or swords.
Instrument used to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems
A weapon, arm, or armament is any device used in order to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems.
Weapon, arm, or armament are terms for any device used to inflict damage or harm to living beings, structures, or systems.

bn:00042221n: Normally tubular weapon or other device designed to discharge projectiles or other material
A weapon that discharges a missile at high velocity (especially from a metal tube or barrel)
A gun is a projectile-firing weapon, which can be either muzzle or breech-loaded.
A gun is a normally tubular weapon or other device designed to discharge projectiles or other material.

bn:00042808n: A handgun, typically with a semi-automatic action and a clip magazine.
A firearm that is held and fired with one hand
A small gun with a relatively short barrel, designed to be held and operated with a single hand.
A handgun is a firearm designed to be handheld, in either one or both hands.
A handgun, with a chamber integrated in the barrel, a semi-automatic action and a box magazine.
The word "pistol" is often synonymous with the word "handgun".
